org.jcouchdb.db
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  org.jcouchdb.db.Database

public class Database
extends java.lang.Object

Contains the main interface of working with a couchdb database

Author:
shelmberger

createDocument

public void createDocument(java.lang.Object doc)
Creates the given document and updates the document's id and revision properties. If the document has an id property, a named document will be created, else the id will be generated by the server. assigned.

Parameters:
doc - Document to create.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the document already had a revision set
UpdateConflictException - if there's an update conflict while updating the document

Bulk creates the given list of documents.

Parameters:
documents -
Returns:

Parameters:

revision - revision to delete

delete

public void delete(java.lang.Object document)
Deletes the given document.

Parameters:
document - document

createOrUpdateDocument

public void createOrUpdateDocument(java.lang.Object doc)
Creates or updates given document and updates the document's id and revision properties. If the document has an id property, a named document will be created, else the id will be generated by the server. assigned.

Parameters:
doc - Document to create.
Throws:
UpdateConflictException - if there's an update conflict while updating the document

updateDocument

public void updateDocument(java.lang.Object doc)
Updates given document and updates the document's revision property.

Parameters:
doc - Document to create.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the document had no revision property
UpdateConflictException - if there's an update conflict while updating the document

                                        java.lang.String fn,
                                        Options options,
                                        org.svenson.JSONParser parser)
Executes the given map / reduce functions and convert the response to a view result of the given class.

Type Parameters:
V - type
Parameters:
cls - runtime type info
fn - map / reduce function as valid JSON string (e.g. { "map" : "function(doc) { emit(null,doc);" }
options - query options
parser - configured JSONParser
Returns:

createAttachment

public java.lang.String createAttachment(java.lang.String docId,
                                         java.lang.String revision,
                                         java.lang.String attachmentId,
                                         java.lang.String contentType,
                                         byte[] data)
Creates the attachment with the given id on the document with the given document id.

Parameters:
docId - document id
attachmentId - attachment id
revision - document revision or null if the document with the given id does not exist.
contentType - content type of the attachment
data - data of the attachment
Returns:
new revision

attachmentId - attachment id

getAttachmentResponse

public Response getAttachmentResponse(java.lang.String docId,
                                      java.lang.String attachmentId)
Returns the Response object for the given document and attachment id. Use Response.getInputStream() to get the input stream of the attachment and when you're done with it call Response.destroy() to clean up.

Parameters:
docId - document id
attachmentId - attachment id
Returns:
